    Working with stl files Make a ternary plot Make a ternary plot from Xfiber data Animate a ternary plot Make Maya mel File

    Make Maya mel File

    make_maya_mel_file.Rmd
    library(MuscleTernary)

AL008 <- read_csv(system.file("extdata",
                             "AL_008_data.csv",
                             package = "MuscleTernary"),
                 show_col_types = FALSE)
AL008
#> # A tibble: 18 × 9

    We’ll pass the parameter write_file = FALSE so that the .mel file is not written to disk. In normal practice, you would set write_file = TRUE (or leave out because this is the default behavior).

    make_mel(stl = "AL_008.stl",
         shader_file = "default",
         data = AL008,
         write_file = FALSE)
#> Assuming that the stl file is found at /home/runner/work/MuscleTernary/MuscleTernary/vignettes/AL_008.stl
#> Writing .mel file to AL_008.mel
#> Reversing the arrowheads. If they point the wrong direction, change rev_arrows to FALSE.
#> Note: the ratio of max to min forces is 352.27
#> The maximum cylinder width is 8. Adjust this based on the size of yourmodel.
